actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1776 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries now printed in the bill, as modified by the amendment printed in section 2 of this resolution, as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-153, by Mr. Beilenson.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 40.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1776) to authorize for fiscal year 1992 the United States Coast Guard budget.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1776 (U.S. Coast Guard budget).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1776) to authorize for fiscal year 1992 the United States Coast Guard budget.
